citeinfo.title: Low to Moderate Income Population by Block Group

descript.abstract: The Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) program requires that each CDBG funded activity must either principally benefit low- and moderate-income persons, aid in the prevention or elimination of slums or blight, or meet a community development need having a particular urgency because existing conditions pose a serious and immediate threat to the health or welfare of the community and other financial resources are not available to meet that need. With respect to activities that principally benefit low- and moderate-income persons, at least 51 percent of the activity's beneficiaries must be low and moderate income. For CDBG, a person is considered to be of low income only if he or she is a member of a household whose income would qualify as "very low income" under the Section 8 Housing Assistance Payments program. Generally, these Section 8 limits are based on 50% of area median. Similarly, CDBG moderate income relies on Section 8 "lower income" limits, which are generally tied to 80% of area median. These data are from the 2011-2015 American Community Survey (ACS). To learn more about the Low to Moderate Income Populations visit: https://www.hudexchange.info/programs/acs-low-mod-summary-data/Data Dictionary: DD_Low to Moderate Income Populations by Block GroupDate of Coverage: ACS 2011-2015
descript.purpose: This service identifies U.S. Census Block Groups in which 51% or more of the households earn less than 80 percent of the Area Median Income (AMI).

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
This is the concatenation of State, County, Tract, and Block Group FIPS codes.
Not Defined in codebook
The name of the block group, place, county, or county subdivision.
The state abbreviation.
The Name of the County.
The numeric Federal Information Process Standards (FIPS) state code.
The numeric Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) county code.
The numeric code for the census tract. In other publications or reports, the code sometimes appears as a 2 digit decimal XXXX.XX.
The block group code.
The count of Low-income persons.
The count of Low- and Moderate-income persons.
The count of Low-, Moderate-, and Medium-income persons for the NSP programs..
Persons with the potential for being deemed Low-, Moderate- and Middle-income. Use as the denominator for LOW, LOWMOD, and LMMI %'s.
The percentage of Low- and Moderate-income persons. Calculated from LOWMOD divided by LOWMODUNIV.
The uncapped count of Low- and Moderate-income persons.
The percentage of uncapped Low- and Moderate-income persons. Calculated from UCLOWMOD divided by LOWMODUNIV.
Length of feature in internal units.
